column1: slants an away-going length ball which he defends with soft hands.
right on top of the bounce of this skiddy delivery as he defends.
thick outside edge, races to the third man boundary. A third slip would've gobbled it up with both hands had he been there
bounce and zip off the pitch! Wanted to leave but this short ball raps him on the glove as he hops to play, rolls past second slip.
gets on top of the bounce and tucks this to the leg side. On the hop as he played that.
right behind the line as he defends this length ball back to the bowler.
sways out of the way of this short of length delivery angling away.
attempts a short ball on his ribcage, but he hops across. This started from outside leg, so given wide.
stands tall and bunts this length delivery to cover
edged and just wide of Amla at second slip, there's third man.
excellent bouncer, this is actually right up there on the speedgun at 143 clicks. He ducks under it but called wide since this was way over the batsman's head
right into the blockhole, dug back to the bowler.
squirted off a thick outside edge to third man again. This was a feeble push from the crease.
arches back to ramp, but lets this short of length delivery go in the end.
floats one a touch fuller and across Tharanga who shoulders arms
right on top of the bounce as he defends this length delivery into the leg side
tucks this off his hip to fine leg, steep bounce off a length again.
caressed through cover point. Sweet. This is too full, he leant into the drive and then allowed his weight to come through to essay that into the gap.
defends this full ball back from the crease.
low full toss on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg.
punched into the gap between cover and mid-off.
driven through the line to cover.
prods outside the line of this length ball to get a thick inside edge towards square leg.
floated full again, punched from the crease to mid-off.
turns this length ball on middle to square leg.
courageous! Steps out and flat-bats this short ball into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Got it a touch high on the bat, but the result wasn't affected as a result.
defends this length ball from the crease.
tucked away fine off his hip to fine leg. Both feet in the air as he negotiated that short ball towards the ribcage
sways out of the line of this short ball angling away.
stands tall and uses just a hint of width to slash this behind point. Absolutely no chance for square third man. Superb
floats it at length outside off, this one holds its line, left alone.
works this short of length delivery to square leg.
slips this length ball down leg, he looks to flick but this was too far down.
shows the full face of the bat and punches this full ball back towards the bowler.
loose drive, not all that full and he threw his bat at that. Beaten because of the late movement.
slants a length ball across, he stands tall and defends into the off side.

you will be cold-hearted to call that a dropped chance. Lovely knuckleball that holds onto the surface, Tharanga check-drives uppishly. This was in the air but Klaasen was on the move to his left as he got his hands around. Tough chance.
driven to cover again.
looks to punch on the up but this keeps a touch low to beat the underedge
thick inside edge on a drive to mid-on, deceived by the offcutter
tucked off his hip to deep backward square leg.
stands tall and bunts this length ball to point
whips this incoming delivery to mid-on as they scamper a quick single
again a slower length ball, he backs away to slash but ends up gliding it down to third man. Once again the ball gripped and bounced.
zippy length ball that whizzes past his inside edge. Once again, Tharanga uncertain about deliveries that are bowled short of length and thereabouts
this time he's ready for the short ball. Almost as if he was going to pull whatever the ball was. It so happened that this was short on middle and he walloped this one bounce to the midwicket fence
squirts this drive to point.
turns this short of length delivery to short midwicket
flicked uppishly to beat the infield on the legside, lovely timing. Even five hours of rain may have not prevented that from not going to the boundary.
uses his pace to steer this behind point. Third man thought he had a chance but saw the ball gather speed and scream to the boundary.
slower ball gone wrong, slips this down leg.
slips this down leg, tucked to square leg off the pad from where there's an overthrow at the keeper's end, they get two extra runs off the deflection.
slashed away, one bounce to square third man.
slips this down leg, he looks to tickle fine but misses.
good length on leg stump, and flicked away to the leg side. Dickwella wants two, but his partner isn't interested
guided fine to third man for a single. Angling away from the batsman as he stuck his bat out
tries to ramp it over the keeper, but Dickwella can't get bat to ball! Short on off, and he got into position to steer it over QdK, but misses out on the contact
length ball on middle, and tapped away to square leg
overpitched outside off, and swept away square to the fielder in the deep. Fifty partnership
full outside off, and he goes for an expansive cover drive. But he's through the shot early, and the ball is inside-edged onto his pads
full on off, and he drives it straight past the bowler's right to long off
full just outside off, and puhsed to cover with soft hands. Stopped by the diving David Miller
full outside leg stump, but Dickwella plays a pre-meditated reverse sweep. Has to drag it out from way too wide, and he eventually mistimes to cover
full on middle, and tapped to the leg side. But Duminy runs across to successfully stop the single
short on middle, and through to the keeper as Tharanga sways out of the ball's line
heavy ball, full on middle, and Tharanga opens his stance before thumping this over the non-striker's head! Hits through the ball's line, and that had four written all over it
too close for the cut! Excellent return delivery. Cross-seamer on middle that angles across Tharanga. He tried to dab it late, but the ball went past the bat's outside edge
good length on middle, and that's been pulled along the ground! Off the bat's sweet spot, but Dala's there at the mid-wicket boundary
good length on off, and ramped off the back foot. Played to the third-man fielder for a walking single
full outside off, and placed (almost) perfectly to the extra-cover boundary. Just a simple lift over the infield, but long off managed to run around the boundary and intercept
full outside off and spinning away. Driven square to the fielder in the deep off the front foot

taken by the captain! Dickwella tries to be cute, and now pays the price for it. Full ball on middle, and he tried to paddle this past the keeper's right. But the ball takes the leading edge, and then pops over to the keeper for a simple dismissal
full on off, but spinning into Kusal's pads. Worked away to the leg side
full on leg stump, and Mendis misses out on the attempted sweep. Hits his front leg, but impact was outside the stumps
floated outside off, and driven with the spin to long on for one
short and wide, but Mendis can't put away the cut! Was well positioned for the shot, but done in by the extra bounce
angling into his hips, and tucked around the corner to deep backward square
good length on middle, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, and flicked away off his toes to the fielder at deep midwicket for a single
good length outside off, but angling further away from the batsman. The umpire has no hesitation but to call it a wide
good length on middle, but Tharanga muscles a pull over midwicket! Stands tall, stays back, and then uses the extra pace to clear the infield with ease
short on middle, but angling across Tharanga. He throws his hands at it, and the cut is top-edged past the keeper for a boundary!
launched! Full on off, and he goes down on one knee to slog-sweep over cow corner! Drags it from outside the off stump as the ball soars into the stands
full, but very wide outside off. Driven away from his body to mid off for a quick single
slower through the air! Lands on middle, but holds up, and therefore defended off the back foot
length ball on middle, and worked off his pads on the leg side
good length on off, and tapped to the leg side off the back foot
full and wide outside off, but Mendis sticks his bat out, and steers a check-cut past point for three more
full and angling into his pads. Mendis goes across the line, and flicks off his pads to the leg side
beauty! Offers the bat's straight face, and sends this over the long-off boundary! Full outside off and that's perfectly in Tharanga's arc to put away

Mulder has the last laugh! Offcutter on a length, and Tharanga is deceived by the lack of pace. Tries to work it to the leg side, but he's made no foot movement, and the ball skids through between bat and pad
good length on off, and angling into Perera's body. Hits his gut area as he misses the leg-side flick

sends the bowler and the non-striker rolling! Full outside off, and it's been drilled straight back. But Mulder tried to get his fingertips to it, and therefore sent the non-striker scampering back, but once the ball beat him, there was no way that wasn't a boundary
aimed at his pads, and he tries to flick it over square leg. But the ball hits his legs as it dribbles away to the leg side
low full toss outside off, and driven straight back to Maharaj
tossed up outside off, and he goes down on one knee to slog towards deep midwicket. Timed well, but two men in the deep for that shot. Reeza Hendricks eventually intercepts
good length on off, and turning into the batsman. He rocks back and works it away to the leg side. Hundred for Sri Lanka
good length outside off, and cut away to point off the back foot. Too close to his body though
overpitched on middle, and Mendis yorks himself by trying to sweep! Hits him in front of middle stump, and the umpire has no hesitation to raise his finger
full on off, and spinning away from Mathews. Pushed to cover with soft hands to get off the mark
length ball on middle, but going further down the leg side. Mathews shoulders his arms and collects the free run
full just outside off, and driven back to the bowler. Mulder holds on to the ball, and then throws at the stumps because Mathews was out of the crease. He misses though
short ball on off, and Mathews rides the bounce to defend
full on middle, and defended back to the bowler off the back foot

dropped! Almost caught and bowled. Full outside off, and the straight drive goes straight to Mulder's left. It came at a comfortable height, and he even got his left hand to it, but the ball just popped out after hitting his palm
good length outside off, and tapped to point off the back foot
overpitched outside off, but Mathews ends the over with a well-timed on drive that pierces the infield!
full outside off, and swept to the fielder at square leg for a quick single
full on leg stump, and driven to short mid on
full on middle, and pushed straight past the non-striker to Phehlukwayo at long on
yorker outside off, but Perera mistimes a drive past the keeper's left to short third man
flatter, but wide outside off. He rocks back and cuts past the square umpire, and into the hands of the man in the deep
full just outside off, and he punches this off the back foot to midwicket. Nobody there, so Maharaj must go chasing behind it

lovely lofted hit. Cleared his front leg and saw this full delivery veering into his swinging arc. Wanted to hit this more towards long-on, but got it off a thickish inside edge over midwicket. Result is what he intended.
slips this slower delivery down leg, wide called.
punches this length delivery to deep point
slower and fuller on off, squeezes the drive to cover.
sways out of the way of this short ball, but this was way over the batsman's head.
stands tall and punches this length ball to extra cover.
slaps this length ball on the bounce to mid-on.
shapes to pull but is beaten for pace, also had to fetch this from way outside off. Mulder is cranking it up her.
fierce sweep with the spin to deep square leg
drift and turn away from middle, Mathews inside edges a drive to midwicket
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery.
gentle dab for a quick single
was looking to mow this across the line but he fired it in full, Kusal nearly yorked himself and had to dig it out.
thick inside edge off a slog sweep to short fine leg.
angles back in off a length and slides down leg, Kusal late on the whip as the ball deflects off the pad to beat short fine leg.

imperious! Pulled all the way over deep backward square leg. Made room, but the bowler followed him. Didn't matter, still managed to power the pull by using his pace. Superb swivel there. Short boundary that side. Hit very very well.
swatted this away between cover and mid-off! Exhilarating stuff. Just a hint of width, slowed it down nicely and he was right up there to slap this.
helps this pull all along the ground to deep backward square leg
slips this down leg, and Mathews uses his supple wrists to flick this into the gap at deep backward square leg
slower length ball outside off, slapped into the gap at sweeper cover.
steps out and launches this over long-off, superb connection. Gave himself some room as he advanced, got underneath the flight and lofted it cleanly.
drifting down, looks to tickle fine but misses. De Kock appeals but the umpire knows this was just a case of the keeper trying to diver his attention
works this full delivery on middle and leg to deep midwicket
punches this to midwicket
if Tony Greig was alive, he sure would've gone 'they're dancing in the aisles in Pallekele.' This is a full toss, may have slipped out of his hand, and he swings this over deep midwicket. Superb.
blocks this yorker length delivery
full toss on middle and leg, worked to deep square.
stands tall and cuts to deep point.

steps out and belts this length ball over the bowler's head. This is stunning from Mathews, slightly cramped for room but went through with the stroke. Mid-on was inside the ring so that was not all that adventurous.

thick outside edge and Quinton de Kock has taken an absolute blinder. This flew off the edge, but he was extremely alert. Took a step to his right and then threw himself full stretch to his right and was airborne, with the ball well past him, as he plucked that out. For a split-second, that looked set to beat Quinton to the boundary. Simply magnificent.
zippy short of length delivery outside off, Dhananjaya shoulders arms.
plays a delightful short-arm jab, the timing simply magnificent. Races to the midwicket boundary.
squeezes this full delivery to mid-off.
ferocious sweep, from outside off. One bounce to the deep midwicket fence. This was a hint slower, enough time to get underneath the flight.
drops short, he makes room and slaps this to the extra cover fence
fired full on the pads, worked to deep square leg.
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery.
steps out, then lunges a little more as he defends back.
works this indrifter to short fine leg.
squared up as he gets a thick edge, in between Amla at a wide slip and de Kock. Not where he intended but it's a boundary.
belts this full delivery to deep cover.
tickles this full delivery to the fine leg boundary. Too easy. South Africa are losing the plot
stands tall and bunts this into the gap at cover to bring up a 28-ball 50, his 11th in ODIs and second of the series.
right on top of the bounce as he bunts to the off side.

oh, dear. What have you done Dhananjaya? Clever slower delivery from Ngidi. Floated this full as well and Dhananjaya just hit this too well to sweeper cover. As he made contact, got the feeling he tried to control the stroke and in the end just ended up checking his stroke.
tossed up on middle, he lunges forward and smothers this.
works this against the turn to deep midwicket
fired full and flat on the stumps, blocked.
steps out, Duminy sees that and fires this down, he somehow manages to squeeze this back.
whips this from outside off to square leg.
punches this back past the bowler towards long-off.
what a welcome back for Dala. Length on middle, he waits for it and then slaps it back past the bowler. The umpire too had to take evasive action
arches back and then slashes, gets it a lot finer than expected, over the keeper's head. Third man comes around to cut that off.
stops on him, punches anyway. On the bounce to mid-on
stands tall and defends this incoming length ball on the stumps.
right behind the line of this incoming delivery as he blocks.
slips this full delivery down leg, looked to work this fine but missed. On the bounce to the keeper.
punches this length ball straight back past the bowler.
rocks back and cuts to deep point.

has he holed out to long-on? Yes, he has. Wanted to hit it a lot straighter as he advanced but Duminy held this back beautifully, Kusal ended up dragging this wider and Miller covered good ground to take a sliding catch running to his left.
tossed up on middle and leg, flicks this full toss to deep square.
works this with the spin from outside off towards wide long-on.
nice flight, he gets well forward and blocks.
once again a good stride in as he defends back to JP.
right into the blockhole, kept out.
squares him up with length as he defends, thick outside edge to third man.
slower and fuller on the pads, flicked to deep square leg.
back of length and slanting back into middle and leg, whipped to deep backward square leg. 200 up for Sri Lanak
sliding down leg, worked to the fine leg region.
touch fuller, just outside off, defended back.
good length on middle, but that's been muscled over the mid-wicket fielder! Just uses the depth of the crease, and then maximises the short length that Duminy bowled in
full on middle, and worked off his pads between the two fielders on the leg side
full just outside off, and he loads up to drive it straight. Struck back to Duminy
full on off, and Shanaka takes one step to his right, and then slog-sweeps over deep midwicket! Hit very square in fact
tossed up, but lands just outside off stump. Played straight to short mid on
very full on middle stump, and he uses his wrists to whip it away past the fielder at midwicket
starts off with the slower ball. Lands outside off, and defended to cover point off the front foot
good length outside off, and cut away off the front foot past point. Stopped by wide third man
slower ball outside off, and he flat-bats a shot straight to mid on! Almost taken by Duminy in fact, but the ball landed just in front of him
through him! Good length on off and angling in. Thisara tries to punch it straight, but the ball jags in and then goes through bat and pad

back of the hand slower ball, but Perera wants to slog this into the ocean! Loads up for a big pull shot, but the ball comes to him very late, by which time he has already swung through the ball's line
wide outside off, and cut to point off the back foot. A good over from Phehlukwayo after an expensive first spell
good length on middle, and he works it off his pads to deep midwicket for a walking single
back of a length outside off, and flicked away to the leg side off the front foot
back of a length outside off, and the attempted punch comes off the bat's top half. Mistimed back to Mulder
full and wide, and the drive has been drilled through the covers. But Dala in the deep does well to ensure it's just a single
good length just outside off, and worked with soft hands to short midwicket. Thisara wants the single, but Shanaka refuses
full just outside off, and thumped over mid off! In his arc, and he makes full use of the extra pace given by Mulder. Takes a big backlift and then swings through the ball's line
short on middle, and through to the keeper. Thisara ducks
wild heave! But lands just beyond Amla at cover. Full and wide, and he slashes this to the off side. In the air for ages, but Amla just couldn't get to it
slower ball that's way too short! Shanaka stays on the back foot, waits for the ball to come to him, and then muscles a pull over deep midwicket

appeal for lbw but was there an inside edge? It was a full ball on off that Shanaka tried to defend. But the ball hit something and flew down to fine leg. Was it bat or pad? Replays say bat first, so South Africa will lose the review
slower ball full outside off stump. Pushed off the front foot to long off
good length outside off, and he sticks his bat out to tap it towards forward cover
back of a length outside off, and nudged away to the leg side for one
full outside off, and that's been driven hard off the front foot! Going to the extra-cover boundary, but long off manages to cut it off
good length outside off, and he steers a tap past point's left. Third man intercepts
full on off, and lifted over the non-striker's head! Off the bat's toe end though, and Maharaj is present at long on
good length outside off, and the flat-batted shot is mistimed back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, but the umpire calls it a wide. On the tramlines, and therefore a 50-50 decision from the umpire
full and wide, and driven through the ball's line to wide long off

almost cleans the bowler up! Glad Ngidi got under the ball - otherwise he would've been very hurt! Length ball outside off, and Thisara smashes this straight through him to the long-off boundary. Ngidi says he's okay
slower ball outside off, and Thisara backs away to steer a late cut to point
short on middle, but angling down the leg side. He misses out on the pull, but no harm done because the umpire calls for a wide
full on middle, and flicked off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
length ball on off stump, but Thisara backs away and crunches a slap through the covers
good length outside off, but with much lesser pace from Ngidi. Shanaka sticks his bat out and runs this down to short third man for one
wiiiild! Full outside off, and he goes for a big swing across the line to try and finish with a boundary. But Ngidi bowls it just out of Thisara's reach, and ends the over with a dot ball
length ball angling into Shanaka's body, and that's been muscled off his hips and into the deep midwicket boundary! Just goes beyond the ropes as Sri Lanka go past 250
too high! And called a no ball too. The ball slipped out of his hand and Shanaka mistimed a flat-batted shot to mid on
full on off, and Perera backs away to heave it over cover. Slices it to backward point instead
yorker outside off, and his drive takes an inside edge to short fine leg
full outside off, and Shanaka comes down the wicket. Tries to drive through the covers, but Dala pushes it too far away, forcing the batsman to mistime the shot instead
off the bat's toe end! Juicy full toss outside off, but it can't be put away. Goes to long on for a walking single
full on off, and Thisara's sliced drive beats the infielder at cover. Man in the deep though
smoked! Back of a length outside off, and that's Thisara territory. Stands tall, rides the bounce, and then deposits this pull to the midwicket boundary
full outside off, and struck straight to mid off. A few metres on either side and that was a boundary for certain
slower ball outside off, but Perera makes some room by backing away and then lifts it over the bowler's head. Just about clears the boundary. A controlled shot on this occasion from Perera
full on off, and Thisara smashes this down the ground to long off
yorker outside off, and he digs this out to Mulder at cover for a quick single
full on off, and Thisara swings through the ball's line to send this shot straight to mid off in no time
full on long on, and driven down the ground to mid on for a walking single
scooped! Full on off, but Shanaka walks across to the off side, sticks his bat out, and then ramps it over short fine leg. Oh man, it's almost gone all the way!
wide full toss outside off, and that's been slapped over cover for four more! Smoked
slower ball on a length, but the ball's angling into his pads. Shanaka simply swings across the line, and the connection off the bat is excellent. Soars into the midwicket boundary. Maiden ODI fifty
full and wide outside off again, and this time the attempted square drive is top-edged to Klaasen at deep point
full just outside off, and the attempted leg-side whip takes the bat's inside half! Runs away to the backward square boundary as Dala concedes 21 off his final over
good length outside off, but too close to his body for the cut. Mistimed to point, but that's good enough for Perera's ninth ODI fifty!
slower ball angling into his pads, and Shanaka opens his chest to go towards the leg side. Swivels on the crease and then deposits this slog behind square on the leg side

straight to cover! But he gets a standing ovation from the Pallekele crowd. Full outside off, and the slap goes to the infielder near the 30-year circle. Thisara congratulates him before Shanaka makes his way back
slower ball which is a full toss on middle. Dananjaya does the smart thing by punching down the ground for a single
good length but too wide outside off. He drags a slog to midwicket for one
short ball outside off stump, but Dananjaya goes to that side to try and ramp it over the keeper. But he misses and that's the end of the innings. Sri Lanka finish on 306 for 7
length ball on off stump, but jagging inwards sharply. De Kock mistimes a cut onto his pads
good length outside off, and punched with the angled bat to point

full outside off, and the attempted drive takes an inside edge, and flies past the keeper's right for a freebie! Could've easily dragged that on to his stumps. Not a very convincing way to reach 4000 ODI runs
good length on middle, and punched straight back to the bowler. Stopped with his right hand
full on leg stump, and that's been clipped off his pads past square leg! No one there in the deep...
good length outside off, and timed well off the back foot. Beats the two infielders as Dananjaya and Dhananjaya give the ball a mighty chase
starts off with ball outside leg stump, and Amla has no trouble in sweeping this fine past the infielder on the leg side! Races away to the fine-leg boundary
full on middle, and the sweep has been top edged! Lakmal's there at short fine leg, but the ball lands just short of him
good length just outside off, and defended to cover
almost played on! Full outside off and the attempted cover drive is inside edged through his legs
half-tracker outside off, and QdK backs away and then slaps a cut in front of square past the fielder at cover! Classy shot
good length on off, and he goes onto the back foot to defend
good length on middle, but going down the leg side. Amla flicks it fine past his hips, and the ball races away for a boundary. Excellent start after the break
full on middle, and worked off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side for a single
full on leg stump, but QdK backs away to the leg side and drills a straight drive over the bowler's head. Oh, beautiful connection
full outside leg stump with QdK backing away. This time he whips it away to the sweeper fielder on the leg side for one
full just outside off, and defended with soft hands to point. They take off for a quick single

Full toss but bowled! What happened there? It was a pretty high full toss on off stump, but it was continuously dipping, therefore forcing an error from QdK. He tried to slap a cut behind square, but the ball has hit the stumps, so it's definitely out, despite the SA captain's disappointment
length ball on middle, and clipped off his pads to the leg side
full on leg stump, but going down leg. Ama misses the flick, but the umpire calls it wide anyway
length ball outside off, so Amla walks across and then taps it square to the leg side
comes in sharply! Full on off but jagging inwards, taking a thick inside edge, and going onto his pads. Thisara's lbw appeal is turned down
whipped! Length on off, and Amla adjusts his line by walking across the stumps and then turns this around the corner
full on off, but tailing inwards once again. Amla takes a big stride forward and drives through the on-side for another boundary
full just outside off, and the cover drive comes off the bat's inside half. Goes to long on instead. End of the Powerplay
full outside off, but Amla opens his bat's face and drives to backward point for a single
full outside off, and he steers a square drive to third man with the angled bat
good length on middle, and nudged of his hips to square leg

gets him second chance! Full outside off, and the straight drive comes off the bat's top half. Flies into the hands of cover, but the ball pops out of his hand momentarily, but Dhananjaya does well to recover and complete the catch
back of a length on off stump, and the attempted pull rolls on to square leg
slower ball full toss on middle stump, and the uncontrolled delivery is comfortably put away by Amla! Bends his knee, gets his bat in front of the leg, and the paddles this fine down the leg side
back of a length on middle, and the pull shot is drilled to deep midwicket for a single
back of a length outside off, and the late cut is run down to third man for a jogging single
back of a length on leg, and Duminy places this pull very fine! Sliding down the leg side and he simply guides it around the corner. Fine leg was too square and JP takes full advantage of that

good length on middle, but Duminy comes charging down the wicket! Swings across the line thereafter and the ball comes off the bat's sweet spot. In the air for ages, but it lands beyond the cow-corner boundary for half-a-dozen
back of a length on leg stump, and the attempted defense takes the leading edge to the leg side. Quick outfield, and enough time for the duo to come back for the second run

back of a length outside leg stump, and Duminy's fine pull down the leg side doesn't come off the bat! But it does take a feather-touch off his thigh pads and the ball races away past the keeper for another boundary
full on off, and he whips this square to midwicket for a single. The fielder takes an aim at the stumps, but he can't force a direct hit
slower ball on a length. Duminy just comes forward, taps to cover, and takes off for another run
full outside off, and he drives with the bat's open face to deep extra cover
like a tracer bullet! It goes to the extra-cover boundary that fast. Full on off and he comes down the wicket before drilling a drive through the off side
flicked fine past Dickwella! Smart cricket from South Africa. Back of a length on leg stump, and Duminy just walks across to the off side and then works it fine for four
good length on middle stump, and that's been worked off his hips to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
full on off stump, and driven down the ground to long off for one
full outside leg stump, and the attempted paddle doesn't come off his bat. Dickwella appeals for caught behind but the umpire isn't interested at all. Amla also gives out a smile
full outside off but Amla takes a big stride forward and converts it into a full toss. Times a cover drive to perfection and beats the infielder at cover
full on middle stump, and flicked away to square leg for a quick single
full on leg stump, and he comes down the wicket, before whipping off his toes to deep backward square leg
tossed up on off stump, and Amla works it to the fielder at cow corner to rotate the strike
dropped by Lakmal! Duminy goes for the reverse sweep from outside leg stump, and the ball went straight into cover's hands. But he fails to hold on to it.
full on middle, and he pushes it with the angled bat to midwicket
Duminy goes to the leg side and therefore the bowler follows him. But Duminy gets inside the line of the ball again, and then collects the run for a wide
length ball on off but Duminy comes down the wicket to slog. He's in no position, and therefore adjusts his shot, eventually defending off the front foot
length ball on middle, and the attempted punch off the back foot takes a bottom edge to square leg for one
full on middle and leg, but Amla just takes a big stride forward to defend
full on middle, and Amla skips down the ground. Drives past the non-striker's right and collects a single at long off
full outside off, but Duminy uses his feet to meet this on the full. Drills a drive to long off as South Africa get to 100
full outside leg stump, and Duminy's attempted sweep does not come off. Goes down the leg side and that's the fifty partnership!
full on middle stump, but Duminy skips down the wicket and then thumps this slog over the midwicket boundary! Boom
misses the reverse sweep! Full on off stump and Duminy's premeditated shot hits his pad instead. The ball flies away to the leg side though, thus allowing them to jog across
sliced to point! Amla was looking so good today. Just full and wide outside off, and Amla's attempted drive over extra cover goes behind square instead
short of a length outside off, punched towards mid-on off the back foot but midwicket gets across to his left to stop
bam! He's plenty settled. Picks Akila's attempted googly, meets it at the pitch outside off and belts it to the wide long-off boundary on the bounce
tossed up at off stump, nice stride forward to flick into the leg side
short of a length slider outside off. Backs away and toe-ends this punch to sweeper cover
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-off from deep in the crease

slapped away but that was close. Got very deep and allowed this length ball to come in as he exposed all the stumps. But in the end, he's timed this to perfection and sweeper has no chance to his right
length ball wide outside, backs away again and swings his arms through it. Slices it through point, uppishly. Sweeper cleans up
short of a length and in at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
swings it to deep midwicket off the back foot. Short ball speared across off stump, drags the pull off the toe-end
short of a length and in at the chest. Gets on his toes and jabs this into the covers. Cramped over there

short of Shehan at sweeper cover. Klaasen gets another off the toe-end. Overpitched ball outside off and it's there for a caning, but he opens the face too early on this. It skies to the sweeper's left and falls short
short of a length outside off, mistimed poke off the bottom of the bat again. Got well outside the line of that
nicely played. Short ball outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
yorker at middle stump, exposes the stumps and jams this into the covers

clears mid-on. After that clean hit off Akila, Klaasen's not quite finding the timing. This short ball hurries at him at chest height in the corridor, he's looking to pull and once again, it's off the toe
yorker jammed into the legs. He looks to swing across the line but it deflects through short third man off his pads

Mathews grabs it at extra cover and chucks the ball into the turf in fury. Sri Lanka have an opening. Klaasen backs away against a length ball that's sliding away from off. Has too much of a reach as a result. Ends up slicing the punch uppishly and Sri Lanka's captain lunges low to his left to hold on
short of a length and angled in at middle stump. Gets back in the crease and punches back to the bowler
short of a length slider at off, hurried punch to extra cover
walks into the off side, allows it to come onto the pad and taps to long-on with the angle

Shanaka has hit the non-striker's stumps and Duminy is gone! That's a terrible decision from Duminy to go for that run, but it is stunning work from the fielder. One stumps to aim at from extra cover and he's done it in a single, smooth motion. Calm pick-up, accurate throw. But you must question the wisdom of going for that run. It was a relatively well-timed tap off the back foot, straight to the fielder. He's short by about two yards
shot. Bouncer in the corridor, gets his weight nicely behind it and spanks it with a grounded pull through midwicket
short of a length outside off, sliced straight to backward point
length ball on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler who chucks it back in his direction. Dickwella cleans up
beaten. Short ball at leg stump, cuts away a touch. Natural variation. Andile swings from under it as it climbs over the stumps
oh that's classy from Andile. Length ball on the pads, short half stride across to cover the line and a nice looking pick-up to beat midwicket to his left
beaten again. Backs away to go over extra cover but misses the overpitched ball going across him
that's beautifully done. Gets his feet in a nice position after stepping out, meets the length ball where it lands and sends a clean drive over the bowler
length ball sliding down leg, can't get bat on the flick
in the air but well short of long-on. Miller looks to pull a short ball coming into him, but he's late on it. It skids on with the moisture
length ball sliding in at off stump, backs away and chops to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, flicks to midwicket off the toe-end
length ball slid into the pads. Cops it on the pads as he gets deep to try and whip this
steps out and under-edges into the off side. Looked premeditated. It was a wide length ball and he's done well to get bat on it after making too much room
short of a length outside off, nice flowing drive on the up to sweeper cover

through him! Andile plays across the line, nowhere near covering the line of that. It can be perilous when the ball is slanting across you, more so when the moisture is adding more zip. He drags it on from outside off
glorious. Pure timing from Mulder. It's short of a length outside off, he waits for it to come on and opens the face very late to run this past point
beaten. Angles in and straightens, while keeping low. Mulder has little idea about this as he gets on the back foot to defend
length outside off, mistimed punch into the covers
short of a length and angled in at the stumps, punched to extra cover
short of a length on off stump, tapped to extra cover with soft hands
into the thigh guard and the crowd is now cheering every dot ball loudly. Mulder steps out and gets cramped by a length ball as he looks to flick it
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on that
inside onto pad and another dot. It rolls past the stumps to Dickwella and Miller has to send Mulder back. Looking to drive this length ball on the up, well away from the body. It's a nervous shot

what a catch. Dhananjaya de Silva leaps to his left and plucks one that's hit quite well from Mulder. He's at short midwicket and this pull shot was travelling. Short ball outside off, he got a clean swing on it but he's going back to the pavilion. Sri Lanka believes
short ball at the stumps, gets behind the line and dabs it into the covers with soft hands
length outside off, punched to long-off on the up
clears cover. A rookie mistake, and so many extra runs. Maharaj lines up on an off stump guard, Lakmal gets the ball wide outside off at a good length and Maharaj swipes under it
length on off stump, jabbed towards extra cover with soft hands
past the outside edge. Maharaj has the right idea, but his attempted poke down to third man against a corridor ball doesn't work out
fumbled and a run-out chance comes to nothing. Length ball in at off stump, nudged towards extra cover. Mathews is quite close and is onto the ball quickly, but is overeager and misses on the pick up

direct hit from long-off and Keshav Maharaj's bold call for the second will be checked by the third umpire. In the meantime, the ricochet has given them an extra run in the leg side. He's in. Miller got a leading edge towards long-off and Maharaj was keen for the second. Came back and slid his bat. Good work. Once again, extra runs earned
under-edge towards the keeper. Looks to run another one down to third man, short and in the corridor
swipes and misses. Short of a length ball with some angle into the corridor. Can't connect
nicely done. Length ball on the pads, flicked to deep square's right for an easy second
short ball in the corridor, chopped down to third man
inside edge past the keeper. Length ball down leg side, a wild heave as he waltzes down leg side and I suppose he's got the desired result
beaten as he looks to slug another one. Short of a length ball rising up at him and he's made room by going down leg again. This sails over the stumps
well bowled. As Maharaj lines up for another swing across the line, Lakmal know what's coming. Bowls an offcutter, short and outside off. Maharaj is through the shot too soon
short and into the body, gets behind the line and drops it into the off side with soft hands

toe-end to mid-off and once again third umpire confirms Maharaj has made his ground. Runs down the pitch and is nicely in position to blaze this length ball through extra cover, but doesn't make good enough connection
length ball across off, looks to guide it between short third man and backward point but find the latter

walloped! What a shot that is! Mathews has his head in his palms after that fizzes past him at extra cover. Thisara's line and length has become a tad predictable. Length ball in the corridor, Mahraja makes room and slaps it. Mean hit.
length ball in at off stump, allows it to come on and gently pokes it into the covers

mix-up and dive, no direct hit from extra cover. Miller might have made it anyway. Taps this length ball in front of that fielder and takes off, then for some reason stops, loses half a second and is forced to scramble. All good for him in the end

bowled him! Top of off. Predictable line and length because it's an effective line and length. Maharaj, who slapped the previous such ball through cover, looks to pull this time. It's not the right shot. The ball skids through from under and tonks off stumo

whacked to sweeper cover and he won't run. It's like bowling in a Test match for Lakmal. Bowls to his off side field. Angle across the corridor. Miller gets a good piece of this but it's straight to the fielder and he won't run

gone! Sri Lanka have engineered this wicket to perfection! A slower ball from Lakmal. You can predict the line and length from the field, you can't predict the pace. Miller, forced into swinging across the line, has not picked the offcutter in the corridor. Looks to slog and gets an inside edge onto stumps
length ball into the pads, a laboured push towards long-on
beats the inside edge and leg stump. Length ball angled into the batsman who's looking to offer the full face as he tries to lift this over midwicket

swings it away and it's a long chase for both deep square and deep midwicket. They've come back for the second. Length ball on the stumps and he hurriedly drags this away. Chance for a third there? Not today
can't get it away. It's a single at extra cover and it's not enough. Lakmal bangs it in, cramps Dala at chest height and the attempted pull splices harmlessly into the off side
